intro: Bulbocodium plantii, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and has a short, flowering stem that rises from the center of the rosette. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Bulbocodium plantii is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a perennial plant with a long lifespan.
